title: Pahari Miniature
hero_image_alt: Lyrical Pahari painting of Radha and Krishna
short_description: A style of miniature painting from the Himalayan hill kingdoms, known for its lyrical nature and focus on love and devotion.
long_description:
Pahari painting is an umbrella term for miniature painting styles that originated in the Himalayan hill kingdoms of North India (Himachal Pradesh, Jammu). 

The most famous schools are:
- **Basohli**: The earliest style, known for bold colors and vigorous lines.
- **Kangra**: Known for its delicacy, lyrical quality, and focus on the Bhakti cult (devotion), especially the love of Radha and Krishna. It is characterized by verdant greenery and fluid lines.
traditional_methods: Similar to Rajasthani miniature but with different aesthetic sensibilities.

major_centres.title: Kangra Valley
major_centres.summary: The home of the Kangra Arts Promotion Society.

authenticity_tips: Look for the portrayal of greenery and the specific profile of the faces.
seo_title: Pahari Miniature Painting: Kangra and Basohli Art
seo_description: Discover the lyrical Pahari miniature paintings of the Himalayas. Explore the romance of the Kangra and Basohli schools.
